com.camerontec.util.io.socket

Interface SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The selectable channel reference type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer, BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer, SpinningSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer

    public interface SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>
    Interface for selectable channel read multiplexer implementations.

    A channel read multiplexer implementation is one which handles input on a number of channels on a single thread of control. That is, inbound I/O is multiplexed across a number channels.

    In general implementations should not interfere (or need to interfere) with the state of any channel. That is, channels are expected to be open, connected (if applicable) and configured non-blocking before being registered. The one exception is that should a channel processor allow an exception to propagate the channel is forcibly closed and de-registered.

    Neither the multiplexing mechanism nor the fairness policy which governs the relative ordering and/or time spent processing inbound I/O on a particular socket channel is specified here. Concrete implementations are likely to differ in both regards.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Future<Integer> deregister(String channelID)
      Deregister a channel from the multiplexer.
      Future<Integer> register(String channelID, T channelReference, SelectableChannelReadProcessor<T> processor)
      Register a channel with the multiplexer.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        Future<Integer> register(String channelID,
                         T channelReference,
                         SelectableChannelReadProcessor<T> processor)
                  throws ClosedChannelException
        Register a channel with the multiplexer.
        Parameters:
        channelID - The channel ID. Must not be null or empty.
        channelReference - The channel reference. Must not be null. The referent channel must not be null, must be connected (if a connection oriented channel) and must either be configured as non-blocking or able to be configured as non-blocking.
        processor - The processor for handling bytes input via the referent channel. Must not be null. Must handle zero length reads (unless the concrete implementation guarantees that it will only callback when the channel is ready for reading) and partial reads. Must also attempt to complete as quickly as possible and never block, otherwise servicing of other channels will be disrupted.
        Returns:
        A future which can be used by the caller to await completion. Completion in this context means that the referent channel is now registered with the multiplexer. The result is the number of channels currently registered.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is null or the channelID is empty.
        ClosedChannelException - If the referent channel is closed.
        NotYetConnectedException - If the referent channel is not open and connected.
        IllegalBlockingModeException - If the referent channel is not configured as non-blocking and cannot be re-configured to be non-blocking.
        IllegalStateException - If the implementation has a limit on the number of outstanding registration/deregistration requests and that limit would be exceeded by accepting this registration.

      • deregister

        Future<Integer> deregister(String channelID)
        Deregister a channel from the multiplexer.
        Parameters:
        channelID - The channel ID.
        Returns:
        A future which can be used by the caller to await completion. Completion in this context means that the specified channel is now de-registered from the multiplexer. The result is the number of channels currently registered.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the channelID is empty.
        IllegalStateException - If the implementation has a limit on the number of outstanding registration/deregistration requests and that limit would be exceeded by accepting this de-registration.
